definitions.definition: To make (someone) aware of (something impending); especially:
To caution or admonish (someone) against unwise or unacceptable behaviour.
definitions.example: Don't let me catch you running in the corridor again, I warn you.

definitions.definition: (chiefly with "off", "away", and similar words) To advise or order to go or stay away.
definitions.example: A sign warns trespassers off/away from the site.

definitions.definition: The action of the verb warn; an instance of warning someone.
Something spoken or written that is intended to warn.
definitions.example: The boss gave him a warning that he would be fired if he did not desist from his behaviour.

definitions.definition: Used to warn of danger in signs and notices.
